member.name: T:Cloo.ComputeObject
member.summary: Represents an OpenCL object.
member.remarks: For the purpose of Cloo an OpenCL object is an object that is identified by its handle in the OpenCL environment.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeObject.Equals(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Checks if two objects are equal. These objects must be cast from ComputeObjects.
member.param: The first object to compare.
The second object to compare.
member.returns: true if the objects are equal otherwise false.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeObject.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Checks if the ComputeObject is equal to a specified ComputeObject cast to an object.
member.param: The specified object to compare the ComputeObject with.
member.returns: true if the ComputeObject is equal with otherwise false.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeObject.Equals(Cloo.ComputeObject)
member.summary: Checks if the ComputeObject is equal to a specified ComputeObject.
member.param: The specified ComputeObject to compare the ComputeObject with.
member.returns: true if the ComputeObject is equal with otherwise false.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeObject.GetHashCode
member.summary: Gets the hash code of the ComputeObject.
member.returns: The hash code of the ComputeObject.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeObject.ToString
member.summary: Gets the string representation of the ComputeObject.
member.returns: The string representation of the ComputeObject.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeObject.Handle
member.summary: Gets or sets (protected) the handle of the ComputeObject.

member.name: T:Cloo.ComputePlatform
member.summary: Represents an OpenCL platform.
member.remarks: The host plus a collection of devices managed by the OpenCL framework that allow an application to share resources and execute kernels on devices in the platform.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputePlatform.GetByHandle(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Gets a ComputePlatform of a specified handle.
member.param: The handle of the queried ComputePlatform.
member.returns: The ComputePlatform of the matching handle or null if none matches.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputePlatform.GetByName(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the first matching ComputePlatform of a specified name.
member.param: The name of the queried ComputePlatform.
member.returns: The first ComputePlatform of the specified name or null if none matches.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputePlatform.GetByVendor(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the first matching ComputePlatform of a specified vendor.
member.param: The vendor of the queried ComputePlatform.
member.returns: The first ComputePlatform of the specified vendor or null if none matches.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputePlatform.QueryDevices
member.summary: Gets a read-only collection of available ComputeDevices on the ComputePlatform.
member.returns: A read-only collection of the available ComputeDevices on the ComputePlatform.
member.remarks: This method resets the ComputePlatform.Devices. This is useful if one or more of them become unavailable (ComputeDevice.Available is false) after a ComputeContext and ComputeCommandQueues that use the ComputeDevice have been created and commands have been queued to them. Further calls will trigger an OutOfResourcesComputeException until this method is executed. You will also need to recreate any ComputeResource that was created on the no longer available ComputeDevice.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputePlatform.ToString
member.summary: Gets the string representation of the ComputePlatform.
member.returns: The string representation of the ComputePlatform.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputePlatform.Devices
member.summary: Gets a read-only collection of ComputeDevices available on the ComputePlatform.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputePlatform.Extensions
member.summary: Gets a read-only collection of extension names supported by the ComputePlatform.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputePlatform.Name
member.summary: Gets the ComputePlatform name.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputePlatform.Platforms
member.summary: Gets a read-only collection of available ComputePlatforms.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputePlatform.Profile
member.summary: Gets the name of the profile supported by the ComputePlatform.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputePlatform.Vendor
member.summary: Gets the ComputePlatform vendor.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputePlatform.Version
member.summary: Gets the OpenCL version supported by the ComputePlatform.
member.remarks: This version string has the following format: OpenCL[space][major_version].[minor_version][space][vendor-specific information].

member.name: T:Cloo.Tools
member.summary: Contains various helper methods.

member.name: M:Cloo.Tools.ParseVersionString(System.String)
member.summary: Parses an OpenCL version string.
member.param: The version string to parse. Must be in the format: OpenCL[space][major_version].[minor_version][space][vendor-specific information].
member.returns: A Version instance containing the major and minor version from .

member.name: T:Cloo.ComputeSampler
member.summary: Represents an OpenCL sampler.
member.remarks: An object that describes how to sample an image when the image is read in the kernel. The image read functions take a sampler as an argument. The sampler specifies the image addressing-mode i.e. how out-of-range image coordinates are handled, the filtering mode, and whether the input image coordinate is a normalized or unnormalized value.

member.name: T:Cloo.ComputeResource
member.summary: Represents an OpenCL resource.
member.remarks: An OpenCL resource is an OpenCL object that can be created and deleted by the application.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeResource.Dispose
member.summary: Deletes the ComputeResource and frees its accompanying OpenCL resources.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeSampler.#ctor(Cloo.ComputeContext,System.Boolean,Cloo.ComputeImageAddressing,Cloo.ComputeImageFiltering)
member.summary: Creates a new ComputeSampler.
member.param: A ComputeContext.
The usage state of normalized coordinates when accessing a ComputeImage in a ComputeKernel.
The ComputeImageAddressing mode of the ComputeSampler. Specifies how out-of-range image coordinates are handled while reading.
The ComputeImageFiltering mode of the ComputeSampler. Specifies the type of filter that must be applied when reading data from an image.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeSampler.ToString
member.summary: Gets the string representation of the ComputeSampler.
member.returns: The string representation of the ComputeSampler.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeSampler.Context
member.summary: Gets the ComputeContext of the ComputeSampler.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeSampler.Addressing
member.summary: Gets the ComputeImageAddressing mode of the ComputeSampler.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeSampler.Filtering
member.summary: Gets the ComputeImageFiltering mode of the ComputeSampler.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeSampler.NormalizedCoords
member.summary: Gets the state of usage of normalized x, y and z coordinates when accessing a ComputeImage in a ComputeKernel through the ComputeSampler.

member.name: T:Cloo.ComputeEventBase
member.summary: Represents the parent type to any Cloo event types.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeEventBase.ToString
member.summary: Gets the string representation of the ComputeEventBase.
member.returns: The string representation of the ComputeEventBase.

member.name: E:Cloo.ComputeEventBase.Completed
member.summary: Occurrs when ComputeEventBase.Status changes to ComputeCommandExecutionStatus.Complete.

member.name: E:Cloo.ComputeEventBase.Terminated
member.summary: Occurrs when the operation associated with the event is abnormally terminated. The status of the

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeEventBase.Type
member.summary: Gets the ComputeCommandType associated with the event.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeEventBase.FinishTime
member.summary: Gets a 64-bit value that describes the device time counter in nanoseconds when the event's command has finished execution.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeEventBase.EnqueueTime
member.summary: Gets a 64-bit value that describes the device time counter in nanoseconds when the event's command is enqueued in the ComputeCommandQueue by the host.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeEventBase.Status
member.summary: Gets the execution status of the associated command.
member.remarks: Is negative if the command's execution was abnormally terminated.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeEventBase.StartTime
member.summary: Gets a 64-bit value that describes the device time counter in nanoseconds when the associated command starts execution.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeEventBase.SubmitTime
member.summary: Gets a 64-bit value that describes the device time counter in nanoseconds when the associated command that has been enqueued is submitted by the host to the device.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeEventBase.Context
member.summary: Gets the ComputeContext associated with the event.

member.name: T:Cloo.ComputeCommandStatusArgs
member.summary: Represents the arguments of a command execution status change.

member.summary: Creates a new ComputeCommandStatusArgs instance.

member.summary: Creates a new ComputeCommandStatusArgs instance.
member.param: The event of the command that had its status changed.
The status of the command.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeCommandStatusArgs.Event
member.summary: Gets the event of the command that had its status changed.

member.name: P:Cloo.ComputeCommandStatusArgs.Status
member.summary: Gets the execution status of the command associated with the event.
member.remarks: Will return a negative integer if the command was abnormally terminated.

member.name: T:Cloo.ComputeCommandQueue
member.summary: Represents an OpenCL command queue.
member.remarks: A command queue is an object that holds commands that will be executed on a specific device. The command queue is created on a specific device in a context. Commands to a command queue are queued in-order but may be executed in-order or out-of-order.

An array of values that describe the offset used to calculate the global ID of a work-item instead of having the global IDs always start at offset (0, 0,... 0).

An array of values that describe the number of global work-items in dimensions that will execute the kernel function. The total number of global work-items is computed as global_work_size[0] *...* global_work_size[work_dim - 1].

An array of values that describe the number of work-items that make up a work-group (also referred to as the size of the work-group) that will execute the . The total number of work-items in a work-group is computed as local_work_size[0] *... * local_work_size[work_dim - 1].
A collection of events that need to complete before this particular command can be executed. If is not null a new ComputeEvent identifying this command is attached to the end of the collection.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeCommandQueue.Flush

The size of the destination buffer row in bytes. If set to zero then equals region.X * sizeof(T).
The size of the destination buffer 2D slice in bytes. If set to zero then equals region.Y * sizeof(T) * destinationRowPitch.
The size of the memory area row in bytes. If set to zero then equals region.X * sizeof(T).
The size of the memory area 2D slice in bytes. If set to zero then equals region.Y * sizeof(T) * sourceRowPitch.
The data written to the buffer.
A collection of events that need to complete before this particular command can be executed. If is not null a new ComputeEvent identifying this command is attached to the end of the collection.
member.remarks: Requires OpenCL 1.1.

The ComputeImage.SlicePitch or 0.
The content written to the ComputeImage.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeImage2D.CreateFromGLTexture2D(Cloo.ComputeContext,Cloo.ComputeMemoryFlags,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new ComputeImage2D from an OpenGL 2D texture object.
member.param: A ComputeContext with enabled CL/GL sharing.
A bit-field that is used to specify usage information about the ComputeImage2D. Only ComputeMemoryFlags.ReadOnly, ComputeMemoryFlags.WriteOnly and ComputeMemoryFlags.ReadWrite are allowed.

One of the following values: GL_TEXTURE_2D, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_X, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Y, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Z, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_X, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Y, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Z, or GL_TEXTURE_RECTANGLE. Using GL_TEXTURE_RECTANGLE for texture_target requires OpenGL 3.1. Alternatively, GL_TEXTURE_RECTANGLE_ARB may be specified if the OpenGL extension GL_ARB_texture_rectangle is supported.
The mipmap level of the OpenGL 2D texture object to be used.
The OpenGL 2D texture object id to use.
member.returns: The created ComputeImage2D.

member.name: T:Cloo.ComputeDevice
member.summary: Represents an OpenCL device.
member.remarks: A device is a collection of compute units. A command queue is used to queue commands to a device. Examples of commands include executing kernels, or reading and writing memory objects. OpenCL devices typically correspond to a GPU, a multi-core CPU, and other processors such as DSPs and the Cell/B.E. processor.

member.name: T:Cloo.ComputeContext
member.summary: Represents an OpenCL context.
member.remarks: The environment within which the kernels execute and the domain in which synchronization and memory management is defined.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeContext.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{Cloo.ComputeDevice},Cloo.ComputeContextPropertyList,Cloo.ComputeContextNotifier,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Creates a new ComputeContext on a collection of ComputeDevices.
member.param: A collection of ComputeDevices to associate with the ComputeContext.
A ComputeContextPropertyList of the ComputeContext.

A delegate instance that refers to a notification routine. This routine is a callback function that will be used by the OpenCL implementation to report information on errors that occur in the ComputeContext. The callback function may be called asynchronously by the OpenCL implementation. It is the application's responsibility to ensure that the callback function is thread-safe and that the delegate instance doesn't get collected by the Garbage Collector until ComputeContext is disposed. If is null, no callback function is registered.
Optional user data that will be passed to .

member.param: A bit-field that identifies the type of ComputeDevice to associate with the ComputeContext.

A delegate instance that refers to a notification routine. This routine is a callback function that will be used by the OpenCL implementation to report information on errors that occur in the ComputeContext. The callback function may be called asynchronously by the OpenCL implementation. It is the application's responsibility to ensure that the callback function is thread-safe and that the delegate instance doesn't get collected by the Garbage Collector until ComputeContext is disposed. If is null, no callback function is registered.
Optional user data that will be passed to .

member.name: T:Cloo.ComputeContextNotifier
member.summary: A callback function that can be registered by the application to report information on errors that occur in the ComputeContext.
member.param: An error string.
A pointer to binary data that is returned by the OpenCL implementation that can be used to log additional information helpful in debugging the error.
The size of the binary data that is returned by the OpenCL.
The pointer to the optional user data specified in argument of ComputeContext constructor.
member.remarks: This callback function may be called asynchronously by the OpenCL implementation. It is the application's responsibility to ensure that the callback function is thread-safe.

member.summary: Creates a new ComputeBuffer from an existing OpenGL buffer object.

The source code for the ComputeProgram.

member.summary: Creates a new ComputeProgram from an array of source code strings.

The source code lines for the ComputeProgram.
member.remarks: The created ComputeProgram is associated with the ComputeContext.Devices.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeProgram.#ctor(Cloo.ComputeContext,System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Byte[]},System.Collections.Generic.IList{Cloo.ComputeDevice})
member.summary: Creates a new ComputeProgram from a specified list of binaries.
member.param: A ComputeContext.
A list of binaries, one for each item in .
A subset of the ComputeContext.Devices. If is null, OpenCL will associate every binary from ComputeProgram.Binaries with a corresponding ComputeDevice from ComputeContext.Devices.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeProgram.Build(System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{Cloo.ComputeDevice},System.String,Cloo.ComputeProgramBuildNotifier,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Builds (compiles and links) a program executable from the program source or binary for all or some of the ComputeProgram.Devices.
member.param: A subset or all of ComputeProgram.Devices. If is null, the executable is built for every item of ComputeProgram.Devices for which a source or a binary has been loaded.
A set of options for the OpenCL compiler.

A delegate instance that represents a reference to a notification routine. This routine is a callback function that an application can register and which will be called when the program executable has been built (successfully or unsuccessfully). If is not null, ComputeProgram.Build does not need to wait for the build to complete and can return immediately. If is null, ComputeProgram.Build does not return until the build has completed. The callback function may be called asynchronously by the OpenCL implementation. It is the application's responsibility to ensure that the callback function is thread-safe and that the delegate instance doesn't get collected by the Garbage Collector until the build operation triggers the callback.
Optional user data that will be passed to .

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeProgram.CreateAllKernels
member.summary: Creates a ComputeKernel for every kernel function in ComputeProgram.
member.returns: The collection of created ComputeKernels.
member.remarks: ComputeKernels are not created for any kernel functions in ComputeProgram that do not have the same function definition across all ComputeProgram.Devices for which a program executable has been successfully built.

member.name: M:Cloo.ComputeProgram.CreateKernel(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a ComputeKernel for a kernel function of a specified name.
member.returns: The created ComputeKernel.
